business.headline: Will gold continue to glitter this wedding season?Gold has always been the heart of Indian wedding traditions, but surging prices and evolving tastes are forcing families to rethink their buying strategy. As the wedding season peaks, one question rings loud — will gold still shine bright, and should you buy now or wait?

Thinking of buying digital gold? Sebi warns it's not a regulated productSebi further clarified that investor protection mechanisms applicable to regulated securities will not extend to such unregulated digital gold schemes.

Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

Lenskart IPO listing next week: Will it deliver profits or disappoint?Lenskart IPO received a strong response from investors, and was subscribed 28.27 times overall, indicating robust demand across categories.

Not 1, 3, or Rs 5 crore. Here's how much Shiv Nadar donated per day last yearShiv Nadar and his family donated a total of Rs 2,708 crore in the last year, which comes to nearly Rs 7.4 crore per day. This is the fourth time in five years that Nadar has topped the list.

Why urban millennials are renting lifestyle products instead of buying themUrban millennials are rewriting the rules of ownership. Instead of buying lifestyle products, from furniture to gadgets, they're choosing to rent. The reason? Flexibility, affordability, and freedom from long-term commitments.

Planning voluntary retirement under UPS? All you need to knowThe guidelines aim to offer clarity and smoother planning for retirement decisions, ensuring eligible employees understand their rights, timelines, and benefits under UPS.

Groww IPO closes today. Here's what the latest GMP signalsWith the IPO closing today, attention now shifts to final subscription numbers and post-allotment reactions. Analysts expect a modestly positive debut given the strong retail response and steady grey market sentiment.

Financial watchdog to seek RBI's help in IndusInd Bank forex hedging probeAs of now, EOW officials have recorded statements of around 12 people from IndusInd Bank, which includes the former top management and other employees in connection with the ongoing investigations into the accounting lapse at the bank of Rs 2000 crore.

Why a magical 12% SIP may not give you solid returns? Expert breaks it downEither compare everything in nominal terms, without adjusting for inflation, or adjust every single figure — contributions, taxes, fees, and final value — for inflation, says expert.

Gold and silver are rising again. What's driving the fresh rally?On Friday morning, gold futures on the MCX were trading around Rs 1,21 lakh per 10 grams, while silver was trading over Rs 1,48 lakh per kg. Both metals have rebounded from their one-week lows, aided by a weaker US dollar and fresh geopolitical tensions.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion payday sounds huge. But can he actually earn it?To actually collect on this historic paycheque, Musk must achieve what Tesla's board calls "Mars-shot milestones", a suite of operational and financial targets.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why stock market is down todayThe broad-based weakness comes as investors continue to digest a mix of global uncertainties, ranging from geopolitical tensions to expectations of prolonged high interest rates in the US.

Lenskart IPO allotment out: Check latest GMP, listing date and moreLenskart's IPO allotment is done, but all eyes are now on its stock market debut. With strong demand and a steady GMP, will India's eyewear leader deliver clear gains?

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7: Anumol crowned winner, Aneesh is runner-up Anumol has been declared the winner of 'Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7', with commoner Aneesh as the first runner-up. The season made history by featuring its first-ever commoner finalist and a diverse lineup of contestants.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Abhishek Bajaj and Neelam Giri evicted The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar' turned intense as Salman Khan confronted housemates over their behaviour, exposing gossip and hidden alliances. The night ended with a shocking double eviction - Abhishek Bajaj and Neelam Giri.

Anil Kapoor beams with pride in birthday note to son Harsh: Your journey is unique Anil Kapoor wished son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor on his birthday with an emotional post, praising his individuality and courage to follow his own path.

Yami Gautam celebrates Haq's box office surge, calls it a cherished moment Yami Gautam celebrated 'Haq's strong box-office performance, calling it a success driven purely by word of mouth. The film, inspired by the Shah Bano case, witnessed 100% growth on Day 2 after its theatrical release.

After Australia, Diljit Dosanjh faces fresh threats from Khalistani goons in Auckland Diljit Dosanjh continues to receive threats from banned Khalistani group SFJ after his gesture of touching Amitabh Bachchan's feet sparked controversy.

Bigg Boss Malayalam 7 finale: Anumol and Aneesh lead as fans await winner Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7 will conclude with its grand finale on November 9, as fans await the announcement of the winner. The final list of contestants has been revealed, and viewers can watch the event live from 7 pm onwards.

Zarine Khan sings Aaj Jaane Ki in video shared by daughter Farah Khan Ali. Watch Zarine Khan, wife of actor-filmmaker Sanjay Khan, died at 81. Daughters Sussanne Khan and Farah Khan Ali paid heartfelt tributes remembering her as their guiding light.

When Anurag Kashyap surprised censor board with a film without violence or abuse Anurag Kashyap shared that when he took his film to the censor board, officials were surprised it didn't include violence or abusive language, which changed his long-held views on censorship. The filmmaker said he now sees the issue as systemic and believes filmmakers must unite to bring reform.

Major Ravi's new film Pahalgam faces backlash from Mohanlal fans ahead of release Major Ravi's upcoming film 'Pahalgam', inspired by real-life military missions, has sparked backlash on social media even before its official announcement. Surprisingly, much of the criticism comes from within Mohanlal's own fan base, questioning the filmmaker's recent track record.

Govinda's wife Ssunita: He is a good son, a good brother, but not a good husband Sunita Ahuja, wife of Bollywood star Govinda, opened up about the challenges of being married to a celebrity, calling it a test of emotional strength. She admitted Govinda made mistakes in the past and said she wouldn't want him as her husband in the next life.

Michael Jackson biopic trailer breaks record with over 116 million views in 24 hours The first trailer for the upcoming Michael Jackson biopic achieved a major milestone, becoming the most-watched music biopic trailer in history after its global debut online.

Orry faces massive backlash for using casteist slur in a video, deletes it later Social media personality Orry faced severe backlash after using a casteist and transphobic slur in a now-deleted Instagram video. Despite deleting the clip, social media users criticised his insensitive remark and called out his repeated pattern of controversial behaviour online.

Jeremy Renner dismisses Yi Zhou's harassment claims as false and misleading Filmmaker Yi Zhou has accused actor Jeremy Renner of harassment and violent behaviour, while Renner has denied all allegations. Both parties had recently collaborated on several film projects before the controversy came to light.

BTS clip: Jaaved Jaaferi and son Meezan dance to De De Pyaar De 2 song. Watch Meezaan Jafri gave fans a Behind The Scenes glimpse of 'De De Pyaar De 2's latest track '3 Shaukk', sharing a fun video with his father Jaaved Jaaferi that's winning hearts online. The BTS clip captures the duo's infectious energy and dance chemistry,

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Tushaar evicted, Vijay Sethupathi roasts Diwaker The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', hosted by Vijay Sethupathi, brought drama with a staged fight prank, heated confrontations, and Tushaar's eviction. Wildcard twists and emotional goodbyes kept viewers hooked.

R Madhavan's intense first look from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar out After Arjun Rampal, R Madhavan's first-look poster from 'Dhurandhar' is out. Starring Ranveer Singh, the film will be out in theatres in December 2025.

Kim Kardashian fails bar exam again, vows to study harder and try once more Kim Kardashian's journey to becoming a lawyer hit a bump after she failed the California bar exam in July 2025. Undeterred, she vowed to study harder and try again, staying committed to her six-year mission and inspiring many with her determination.

The Girlfriend box office Day 2: Rashmika's emotional drama sees strong growth Rashmika Mandanna's 'The Girlfriend' is off to a strong start, nearly doubling its Day 2 box office with Rs 2.5 crore. With rising occupancy and positive word-of-mouth, the film is winning praise for Rashmika's heartfelt performance and growing audience appeal.

Why Anupama Parameswaran filed cyber case against 20-year-old woman: Read here Actor Anupama Parameswaran has reported an organised online harassment campaign to the Kerala Cyber Crime Police, calling attention to the growing issue of cyberbullying. She urged people to use social media responsibly.

general news.headline: Shashi Tharoor speaks for himself: Congress distances itself from Advani remarkThe Congress on Sunday distanced itself from party MP Shashi Tharoor's recent comments defending BJP veteran LK Advani, clarifying that his views were personal and did not reflect the party's position.

Mohan Bhagwat says Muslims, Christians can come to RSS but on one conditionRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat clarified that followers of all faiths are welcome to participate in the Sangh as long as they come "as sons of Bharat Mata".

Daaru, chakna and 'party all night': New videos from Bengaluru prison surfaceIn the latest videos, inmates can be seen using plates and mugs as musical instruments while shouting, "Party all night." The latest visuals come a day after the prison was at the centre of a storm following videos of several prisoners, including an ISIS recruiter and a rapist-murderer, receiving VIP treatment.

Delhi air remains 'very poor', pollution body says GRAP-3 curbs not needed for nowThe pollution body said that given that Delhi's daily average AQI has shown a consistent declining trend and forecasts indicate it will stay in the 'very poor' category, invocation of Stage III of GRAP is not required at the moment.

The next wave of layoffs might not be in offices but on the streetsDrones are being used for deliveries in Gurgaon and Bengaluru. Amazon is trying out AI automation at its warehouses. But the 12 million people in India's gig economy are oblivious of that. From millions of additions to the workforce to automation, India's gig economy is set for an upheaval. Will that be the end of the road for the millions who are always on the move but never move up?

After Australia, Diljit Dosanjh faces fresh threats from Khalistani goons in AucklandDiljit Dosanjh continues to receive threats from banned Khalistani group SFJ after his gesture of touching Amitabh Bachchan's feet sparked controversy.

Down with dictatorship: Protests rage in Pak over sweeping powers to Asim MunirIf enacted, the current amendment would represent one of the most far-reaching constitutional overhauls in Pakistan's recent history.

As Delhi chokes, residents rally at India Gate demanding action, several detainedIndia Gate witnessed a nearly 30-minute protest before police began cracking down on demonstrators and started detaining them. One protester said they were not being allowed to protest peacefully and were instead being evacuated.

Escapade Mars mission launch tonight: Bezos to attempt rocket landingBlue Origin will attempt to land the massive New Glenn rocket's first stage on a recovery ship at sea, aiming to enhance rocket reusability.

Violence erupts in Bihar's Gopalganj following false rumours of biker's deathAccording to police, the accident occurred around 6:30 to 7:00 pm when a police vehicle carrying the Circle Inspector was heading toward the police lines.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

'Do you know about Mamdani?' Masked US immigration agents grill Indian-origin manAn Indian-American employee of the Illinois Department of Transportation was stopped by masked agents at a worksite, prompting condemnation from the governor and raising questions about the agents' authority and motives.

Kranti Gaud's World Cup heroics help father reclaim Police job after 2012 setbackKranti Gaud's outstanding performance in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 has led to her father's reinstatement in the police force. Kranti's father, Munna Singh Gaud, served as a constable in the police force before being dismissed in 2012, which pushed the family into financial turmoil.
Rahul Gandhi made to do 10 push-ups as punishment in Panchmarhi. This is whyCongress training camp chief Sachin Rao announced Rahul Gandhi had to do 10 push-ups as punishment for arriving late.

Survey lets you peep into homes? Aaditya Thackeray questions Mumbai body over droneThe Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) later clarified that the drone was part of a survey for the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) and said it had obtained approval from Mumbai Police. Thackeray, however, doubted the explanation and pointed out the lack of communication with residents.

Muslim couples in Bengal opt for Special Marriage Act amid wariness over SIRThe spike was witnessed in the same period when a similar Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls took place in neighboring Bihar. Bengal's own SIR process began this November.

R Madhavan's intense first look from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar outAfter Arjun Rampal, R Madhavan's first-look poster from 'Dhurandhar' is out. Starring Ranveer Singh, the film will be out in theatres in December 2025.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Won't drop our conditions: Russia's Lavrov says he is ready to meet Marco RubioNearly four years since Vladimir Putin sent thousands of troops into Ukraine, Russian forces are grinding forwards and control about 19% of Ukraine.

CSK hopeful of Sanju Samson trade, RR still weighing options: ReportChennai Super Kings are reportedly set to land Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson in a blockbuster IPL 2026 trade. The deal could see CSK stalwart Ravindra Jadeja and England all-rounder Sam Curran move to Rajasthan.

Two dead as Super Typhoon Fung-Wong batters Philippines, over million evacuatedThe bodies of the two deceased persons were recovered by local authorities. Sources claimed, one person drowned in Catanduanes, and the firefighters recovered the other person's body from the debris of a collapsed home in Catbalogan City.

Grandfather arrested in sexual assault case of 4-year-old Bengal girlHooghly Rural Superintendent of Police, Kamnashish Sen, announced that a five-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been formed to probe the incident.

After the Oscar nod: Rima Das and the story you haven't heardShe made Assam visible to the world with Village Rockstars. Now, in Anything But, Rima Das talks about what fame changes, her take on love, life and Zubeen da.

Anil Kapoor beams with pride in birthday note to son Harsh: Your journey is uniqueAnil Kapoor wished son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor on his birthday with an emotional post, praising his individuality and courage to follow his own path.

Yami Gautam celebrates Haq's box office surge, calls it a cherished momentYami Gautam celebrated 'Haq's strong box-office performance, calling it a success driven purely by word of mouth. The film, inspired by the Shah Bano case, witnessed 100% growth on Day 2 after its theatrical release.

sports.headline: Archer, Wood's pace will surprise ageing Australian batters in Ashes: Greg Chappell Former Australian captain Greg Chappell has cautioned Australia about England's formidable fast bowling lineup as the home side prepares to field its oldest Test team in over 90 years. The Ashes 2025-26 is set to begin on November 21 in Perth.

CSK hopeful of Sanju Samson trade, RR still weighing options: Report Chennai Super Kings are reportedly set to land Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson in a blockbuster IPL 2026 trade. The deal could see CSK stalwart Ravindra Jadeja and England all-rounder Sam Curran move to Rajasthan.

Prayed to God to win World Cup for fans and aspiring girls in India: Radha Yadav India spinner Radha Yadav has revealed that she was praying to god to help them win the Women's World Cup for their fans and aspiring young girls of India. India beat South Africa by 52 runs to clinch their maiden Women's World Cup in Navi Mumbai.

Watch: Beth Mooney's witty comeback to Jemimah Rodrigues' World Cup semi-final joke Beth Mooney responded with a witty comeback to Jemimah Rodrigues' World Cup semi-final joke during Perth Scorchers' WBBL 2025 opener. The playful exchange had fans laughing. what came as an aftermath of India's World Cup winning campaign.

Kevin Pietersen 'not surprised' by fearless Abhishek Sharma's rise in T20Is Kevin Pietersen praised Abhishek Sharma as the most complete T20 batter in the world following his second successive Player of the Series award against Australia after India's 2-1 victory.

Australia linking cricket with politics not good for game: Afghanistan selector Former Afghanistan cricketer Asadullah Khan has criticised Australia for mixing politics with cricket due to women's rights issues in the country. Australia haven't kept any bilateral cricketing relations ever since Taliban's takeover of the country in September 2021.

Pakistan clinch record sixth Hong Kong sixes title with 43-run win over Kuwait Pakistan secured their sixth Hong Kong Sixes crown on Sunday, defeating Kuwait by 43 runs in a high-scoring final at Tin Kwong Road Recreation Ground. Captain Abbas Afridi starred with a rapid half-century, while Kuwait impressed in their maiden tournament appearance.

AIFF moves to Supreme Court again after ISL tender receives no bidders Indian football faces fresh turmoil as the AIFF informed the Supreme Court that the ISL commercial rights tender received zero bids. With the league suspended, the sport's immediate future is now hanging by a thread.

Hockey player Julie Yadav dies after road accident in Lucknow A young national-level athlete's life was cut short in a tragic road accident in Lucknow on Sunday. The death of 23-year-old sports teacher Julie Yadav has left her family and local sporting circles devastated.

Kranti Gaud's World Cup heroics help father reclaim Police job after 2012 setback Kranti Gaud's outstanding performance in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 has led to her father's reinstatement in the police force. Kranti's father, Munna Singh Gaud, served as a constable in the police force before being dismissed in 2012, which pushed the family into financial turmoil.

Shafali Verma on year-long battle to claim World Cup glory: God rewarded my efforts Shafali Verma's late call-up turned into a World Cup-defining masterclass as she powered India's historic title win. Her year of struggle, rebuilding and belief came together on the biggest night of her young career.

Captain Abbas Afridi starred with a rapid half-century, while Kuwait impressed in their maiden tournament appearance.

Kranti's father, Munna Singh Gaud, served as a constable in the police force before being dismissed in 2012, which pushed the family into financial turmoil.

Shafali Verma on year-long battle to claim World Cup glory: God rewarded my efforts Shafali Verma's late call-up turned into a World Cup-defining masterclass as she powered India's historic title win. Her year of struggle, rebuilding and belief came together on the biggest night of her young career.

R Ashwin hails Jordan Hermann for heroic knock against India's Test bowlersRavichandran Ashwin took to social media to acknowledge South Africa A opener Jordan Hermann's composed 94-run knock against India A bowling attack consisting of senior Test stars namely Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna, Kuldeep Yadav and Akash Deep.

I miss Jurgen Klopp: Pep Guardiola pays tribute to former Liverpool managerPep Guardiola has openly stated he misses Jürgen Klopp, his long-standing rival, ahead of Manchester City's latest Premier League fixture against Liverpool. Guardiola and Klopp shared a rivalry that was deep-rooted in mutual respect.

South Africa A stuns India's Test stars, chase down 417 to level seriesSouth Africa A achieved a remarkable victory by chasing 417 in the second unofficial Test in Bengaluru against a star-studded bowling attack of India A to level the series 1-1.

Radha Yadav credits family's belief behind her World Cup triumph with IndiaRadha Yadav opens up on her family's fight against stigma and doubt as India lifted its first Women's World Cup. The left-arm spinner reflects on faith, pressure and the journey that shaped her rise.

Hasan Nawaz released from Pakistan's SL ODIs, tri-series squads after poor formPCB has decided to send Hasan Nawaz back to the domestic circuit and drop him from the Pakistan ODIs and T20I tri-series squads. Nawaz has been struggling for form recently as he failed in the South Africa ODI and T20I series.

Meghalya's Akash Choudhary hits 8 successive sixes, fastest 50 in first classMeghalaya's Akash Choudhary made history by hitting 8 successive sixes and the fastest fifty in first class cricket. He achieved the feat against Arunachal Pradesh's Limar Dabi during Ranji Trophy Plate League fixture in Surat.

Will speak to Yuvraj Singh about Abhishek Sharma's weakness: Ex-India cricketerFormer India cricketer Irfan Pathan joked that he will discuss about a weakness of Abhishek Sharma with Yuvraj Singh. Abhishek was the Player Of The Series against Australia in the T20I series.

Nawaz has been struggling for form recently as he failed in the South Africa ODI and T20I series.

He achieved the feat against Arunachal Pradesh's Limar Dabi during Ranji Trophy Plate League fixture in Surat.

Will speak to Yuvraj Singh about Abhishek Sharma's weakness: Ex-India cricketerFormer India cricketer Irfan Pathan joked that he will discuss about a weakness of Abhishek Sharma with Yuvraj Singh. Abhishek was the Player Of The Series against Australia in the T20I series.

Should CSK trade Ravindra Jadeja for Sanju Samson? Grave mistake, says ex-playerRumours suggest that Chennai Super Kings are ready to trade Ravindra Jadeja for Sanju Samson. Former cricketer Priyank Panchal warns CSK against what he calls is a grave mistake.

Ryan Williams joins Indian camp for Asian Cup qualifier vs BangladeshRyan Williams has joined the Indian national football team in Bengaluru. His inclusion highlights a strategic shift towards India's ambition in world football. Williams relinquished his Australian passport for this opportunity.

Sundar wins Impact Player award after India seal T20I series vs AustraliaWashington Sundar received the 'Impact Player of the Series' medal after India clinched the T20I series 2-1 in Australia. The all-rounder was all smiles as team operations manager Rahil Khaja presented him with the award.

Is Shubman Gill a burden to India's new-age T20I team?Shubman Gill is a generational talent, no doubt. But if his tempo disrupts India's T20I rhythm and forces others out of position, the question isn't whether he is good enough. It's whether he is the right fit for a side that has succeeded by attacking fearlessly.

More valuable than Jasprit Bumrah: Badrinath's stunning claim on India bowlerFormer cricketer Subramaniam Badrinath feels that Varun Chakravarthy is a more valuable player for India than star pacer Jasprit Bumrah. Chakravarthy picked up five wickets in five matches for India during the Australia series.

Women's World Champion Shafali Verma gets hero's welcome in hometown RohtakIndia's Women's World Cup 2025 star Shafali Verma received a hero's welcome as she returned to her hometown of Rohtak. Shafali was the Player Of The Match in the final as India defeated South Africa.

Was not sure if Australia would let me cross their border: Jemimah RodriguesJemimah Rodrigues joked while playing in the Women's Big Bash League that she was not sure whether she would be allowed to cross the Australian border. Jemimah's epic knock of 127* knocked Australia out of the World Cup.

Hong Kong Sixes: Another defeat, India finish campaign with 4 losses in a rowIndia finished their Hong Kong sixes campaign with yet another defeat. The Dinesh Karthik side lost to Sri Lanka in their final match of the invitational tournament. After starting with a win against Pakistan, India lost matches to Kuwait, UAE, Nepal and Sri Lanka.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
